an4.13:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these four right endeavors.
an4.13:4.3: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities don’t arise.
an4.13:4.4: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities that have arisen are given up.
an4.13:4.5: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities arise.
an4.13:4.6: They generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development.
an4.13:4.7: These are the four right endeavors.”
an4.13:5.1: “By rightly endeavoring, they’ve crushed Māra’s dominion;
an4.13:5.2: unattached, they’ve transcended the danger of birth and death.
an4.13:5.3: Contended and still, they’ve defeated Māra and his mount;
an4.13:5.4: now they’ve gone beyond all Namuci’s forces, they’re happy.”
